input_data.title: Trying
input_data.overview: All Nikki and Jason want is a baby—the one thing they can’t have. So they decide to adopt. With their dysfunctional friends, screwball families, and chaotic lives, will the adoption panel agree that they’re ready to be parents?

response.analytical_summary: Trying is a comedic series centered on a couple navigating the adoption process. The show explores themes of family, friendship, and the challenges of parenthood through a humorous and often chaotic lens. It blends observational comedy with heartfelt moments, examining the complexities of relationships and the desire to build a family, even when faced with personal and societal obstacles. The series offers a lighthearted yet poignant look at the pursuit of parenthood and the importance of support systems.
response.spoiler_rich_plot_summary: Nikki and Jason, a couple desperate to start a family, decide to pursue adoption. Their journey is complicated by their eccentric friends and the scrutiny of the adoption panel. Throughout the series, they face numerous hurdles, including navigating bureaucratic processes, dealing with the opinions of their well-meaning but often intrusive friends and family, and confronting their own insecurities about their readiness to be parents. They encounter potential adoptees and their families, gaining a deeper understanding of the complexities of adoption and the importance of finding the right match. As they progress through the process, they learn valuable lessons about themselves, their relationship, and the true meaning of family. While facing setbacks and moments of doubt, they ultimately persevere, demonstrating resilience and a unwavering commitment to their dream of becoming parents. The series culminates in a poignant and hopeful resolution as they finally move closer to fulfilling their desire for a child.
response.keyword_sentence: Trying is a lighthearted sitcom exploring the comedic and heartwarming journey of a couple pursuing adoption, highlighting the importance of friendship and family as they navigate the challenges of parenthood.
